Activity.title: Activity
Activity.description: Represents a single user activity log entry in the system.

Company.title: Company
Company.description: Represents a company served by the accounting firm.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Company entity.

cnae.description: National Classification of Economic Activities (CNAE) code of the company.

taxRegime.description: Tax regime of the company (e.g., Simples Nacional, Lucro Presumido).

registrationStatus.description: Registration status of the company (e.g., Apto, Inapto, Baixado).

startDate.description: Date when the company started its activities.

mainContactId.description: Reference to User. Main contact person within the company. (Relationship: User 1:N Company)

certificateA1Validity.description: Expiration date of the A1 digital certificate.

certificateA1Url.description: URL of the A1 certificate file in Firebase Storage.

User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the system, either internal or a client.

uid.description: Unique identifier for the User entity, matches Firebase Auth UID.

roleId.description: Reference to the Role entity that defines the user's permissions.

photoURL.description: URL of the user's profile picture.

Role.title: Role
Role.description: Defines a set of permissions for a user role.

Partner.title: Partner
Partner.description: Represents a partner or administrator associated with one or more companies.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Partner entity, usually the CPF.

qualification.description: The partner's qualification or role in the company (e.g., Sócio-Administrador).

hasECPF.description: Indicates if the partner has an active E-CPF.

ecpfValidity.description: Expiration date of the E-CPF certificate.

ecpfUrl.description: URL of the E-CPF certificate file in Firebase Storage.

govBrLogin.description: Partner's login for the GOV.BR portal (stored encrypted).

govBrPassword.description: Partner's password for the GOV.BR portal (stored encrypted).

associatedCompanies.description: List of company names the partner is associated with.

otherData.description: Field for other relevant partner data.

TaxObligation.title: TaxObligation
TaxObligation.description: Represents a tax obligation for a specific company, including its history and related documents.

id.description: Unique identifier for the TaxObligation entity.

companyId.description: Reference to Company. Company to which the tax obligation belongs.

companyName.description: Denormalized name of the company for quick display.

nome.description: Name of the obligation (e.g., DAS, DEFIS, SPED ECF).

description.description: Internal notes or observations about the obligation.

periodo.description: The competence period of the obligation (e.g., '2024-08').

responsavelId.description: Reference to User. User responsible for this obligation.

responsavelNome.description: Denormalized name of the responsible user.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the obligation was created.

Document.title: Document
Document.description: Represents a document stored in the system.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Document entity.

companyId.description: Reference to Company. Company to which the document belongs. (Relationship: Company 1:N Document)

type.description: Type of document (e.g., Contract, Certificate, Fiscal Archive).

uploadDate.description: Date when the document was uploaded.

expirationDate.description: Expiration date of the document, if applicable.

responsibleUserId.description: Reference to User. User responsible for this document. (Relationship: User 1:N Document)

CorporateProcess.title: CorporateProcess
CorporateProcess.description: Represents a corporate process related to opening, altering, or closing a company.

id.description: Unique identifier for the CorporateProcess entity.

companyId.description: Reference to Company. Company to which the corporate process belongs. (Relationship: Company 1:N CorporateProcess)

processType.description: Type of corporate process (e.g., Opening, Alteration, Closing).

startDate.description: Start date of the corporate process.

protocolDate.description: Protocol date of the corporate process.

status.description: Current status of the corporate process.

Invoice.title: Invoice
Invoice.description: Represents a monthly fee or invoice for a company.

companyId.description: ID of the company this invoice belongs to.

companyName.description: Denormalized name of the company for display.

referencePeriod.description: The reference period for the invoice (e.g., '2024-08').

amount.description: The total amount of the invoice.

dueDate.description: The due date for the payment.

paymentDate.description: The date the invoice was paid.

status.description: The current status of the invoice.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore data structure is designed to support the features of the ContaFlow ERP system, focusing on security, scalability, and maintainability. Key considerations include role-based access control, efficient data retrieval, and support for the core features like fiscal document processing, tax obligation management, corporate lifecycle management, financial data integration, and comprehensive document repository.

Authorization Independence is achieved through denormalization. For example, instead of relying on nested `get()` calls to verify a user's role within a company, the user's role (or relevant permissions) are copied into documents where authorization is required. Specifically:

*   **Company Membership:** A `members` map within the `companies/{companyId}` document stores user roles for that company.  This is then copied to subcollections if needed.
*   **User Roles:** Global roles (Admin, etc.) are managed using existence checks in dedicated collections (e.g., `/roles_admin/{userId}`).

This design supports the required QAPs (Rules are not Filters) by:

*   **Structural Segregation:** Data with different access requirements are stored in separate collections.  User-specific data (like settings) resides under `/users/{userId}`, while company-specific data resides under `/companies/{companyId}`.
*   **Membership Model:** Collaborative data (e.g., documents, tax obligations) associated with a company uses the `members` map denormalized from the company document for access control.

Furthermore, the structure facilitates:

*   **Efficient Queries:** By avoiding nested `get()` calls, queries are more efficient and scalable.
*   **Simplified Security Rules:** Rules are more straightforward to write and debug because authorization logic is localized.
*   **Atomic Operations:** Transactions and batch writes are supported because authorization checks do not depend on hierarchical data.

Each entity has a dedicated collection, and relationships between entities are managed via document references. This approach ensures clarity, consistency, and ease of maintenance.
